Fun puzzle game

Great game, but glitchy compared to old version. The new graphical interface is an improvement, though it was not bad before, either. This is a great pass and play or solo game! Now when are they going to add online play?

Was awesome, then they changed the user interface and made it so you could see alternative moves. Terrible now. It's not as fluid, everything takes longer. That might work for a beginner but replayability is no good. Sadly, deleting.

I used to love this game but they did a big update. The new graphics are nice but they replaced some of the old bugs with some new, much more frustrating bugs and overall playability is down. I used to play 2-3 times a day, now I barely touch it.

Updated version is AWFUL! Used to play this every day, multiple times a day. It was a perfect game - I took a break and am devastated by this update. User interface is so bad, it's crowded and you can't see anything on the screen. It's slow, things take more clicks, it's darker and difficult to discern details...it's ruined. Seems like looking flashy was more important than working well. I can't express enough how bad this update is - I wish I could play the old version.

Echoing everyone else on ze internet, the recent April 2020 software update changed the game from a household favorite to the bane of existence. The list of downgrades is too long. Maybe a few icon changes were improvements, but they are not memorable enough to recall. Seriously, if one could revert to the older version, I bet 999 out of 1000 players would revert. Please do not inflict more pain on players (who are also customers) by maintaining this new version. At a minimum, provide players with the ability to restore the older version, understanding the developer may not enhance it further. I think that is what the public wants. In this time of actual national emergency - do the right thing - restore old version, and stop making excuses for a poor software release.

New update sucks. Old one was much easier to move people and in the new version it isnt clear enough when outbreaks happen. I LOVED this game before this recent update. I played at least once a day, but now I think I'm going to have to stop because it's AWFUL.

I like the game but hate the new update.
the new version simply destroyed a game which was fun, fast, simple and that I played several times a day. A rollback is sorely needed.

If I could rate this ZERO stars, I would. I've been playing this on Android for years, and prior to this update it was easily a well made, high functioning, five-star game. Old version was great. Unnecessary update has ruined this digital version of a great game.

New version sucks. They made it all fancy which slows game play massively. I just want the basics and I want the parts to move faster. I used to be able to play a game in about 12 min. Now it takes twice as long because they wanted to go fancier w graphs that hurt game play.

Very faithful to the original game and easy to play as one or more players. No significant glitches or bugs. Only potential improvement would be an in-app Chromecast (rather than the phone's screen cast) function to improve picture quality playing on a TV.

Hating the new update, ruined a perfect game. Too slow now, can't see the discards as well as the previous version. Needs some major fixes.

5 star reviewcwas for old layout. Very much dislike new version.

Love this game on the actual board, and the app version is slick, but the "lose when there are no more cards to draw" rule makes this game *unfairly* hard to play when you're using the "On the Brink" expansion material and five players.  Yes, the game is supposed to be hard, but it's not supposed to be THAT hard- it's an actual imbalance in the game caused by the OTB expansion, which can be compensated for fairly in real life by simply reshuffling the draw deck- but no such option exists in the app.  Win rates drop below 1%, which isn't what I'd call "hard", it's what I'd call a waste of time.  Literally, a waste of time.  It's not fun when you know the game is rigged so heavily against you- there's not a better strategy that can be employed, one can only play hundreds of times with perfect play-style in the hopes that one of those times you will be lucky enough through a combination of starting characters, hands, disease positions, and deck compositions; such that through your extreme luck you finally get to see the victory screen.  I did it, and I can tell you the victory screen is just not that special... it's not worth your time.  As such, I can only give this game 1 star.  If it had options for various house rules (like reshuffling the draw deck as one clear example) I would give it a full 5 stars.  If it had house rule options and the other expansions included like "In the Lab" then I would give it 6 stars if I could.  But it doesn't hve these things, so I must reiterate: 1 star, and not worth your time if you want to play OTB.  I suppose if you just want to play the original game it's fine, but the original has significantly less replay value.

Pandemic is meant to be challenging.

The following guidelines will help:
1- Play Introductory difficulty.

4- Prioritize the Medic to treat cubes.
5- Use the Scientist-Researcher combo to find cures.

Good Luck!
